comments.value:
Hello

A few more tweaks to the Volunteering template, please!

Pink include - I can't seem to edit this in either IE8 or FF. Is it possible to change the link to point to 'Volunteer in your area' - http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php Also, the rollover link in this module is underlined in black in IE8 but should be white like the text please.

Volunteering info template - please can you remove from this template the feature boxes for Related photos and Related videos

Home page - please remove entirely the pink button which currently says 'Have you got what it takes', plus the 'Related photos' and 'Related videos' boxes

Landing page - we want to remove the promos on this page and extend the picture down, so that it can show a range of different pictures which we are using in the ad campaign, while also featuring one clear link above the fold to 'Enter the site'. I'm not sure if this is something you can do or if I need to send this back to McCann to rework entirely. Can we discuss this?

Home page - media pod - is it possible for me to edit this using the XML? Is this still hosted by McCann? I think we need to ensure this is hosted by us, as we will need to ensure it goes on the cloud ready for launch on 27 July.

Page titles at the top of picture pods all templates - please can you ensure that the headers for the picture pods are bold, as per the home page? e.g. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php 

Blue include for alternative content forms - I can't edit this - should I be able to? Is it possible to delete the bit about the MP3 download?

Promos on Volunteering about hub template - I can still only edit this in Firefox, not in IE8.

Thank you!

1a) Pink include - I can't seem to edit this in either IE8 or FF. Is it possible to change the link to point to 'Volunteer in your area' - http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php I may have fixed this and made it editable, what page does it show on? (Lars any idea why you commented it out?) *this week* 1b) Also, the rollover link in this module is underlined in black in IE8 but should be white like the text please. OK will update the CSS *this week* 2) Volunteering info template - please can you remove from this template the feature boxes for Related photos and Related videos - will do *this week* 3) Home page - please remove entirely the pink button which currently says 'Have you got what it takes', plus the 'Related photos' and 'Related videos' boxes - will do *this week* 4) Landing page - we want to remove the promos on this page and extend the picture down, so that it can show a range of different pictures which we are using in the ad campaign, while also featuring one clear link above the fold to 'Enter the site'. I'm not sure if this is something you can do or if I need to send this back to McCann to rework entirely. Can we discuss this? - will wait for McCann to come back, we just need the CSS/HTML for the 'Content'
It may be best to send them a link to the live site so they can edit the page and just change this bit, we will then need to move it back into the CMS
... this is the div that changes ...
* Dependent on McCann / plus time to implement * 5) Home page - media pod - is it possible for me to edit this using the XML? Is this still hosted by McCann? I think we need to ensure this is hosted by us, as we will need to ensure it goes on the cloud ready for launch on 27 July. - Need McCann to supply a new Flash player that takes a local XML or JSON file or the Flash movie should accept a list of values. * Dependent on McCann / plus time to implement * 6) Page titles at the top of picture pods all templates - please can you ensure that the headers for the picture pods are bold, as per the home page? e.g. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php - Will change CSS *this week* 7) Blue include for alternative content forms - I can't edit this - should I be able to? Is it possible to delete the bit about the MP3 download? - We'll tackle it as part of this ticket (which omits the need to remove the MP3) http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1034 *will try for this week* 8) Promos on Volunteering about hub template - I can still only edit this in Firefox, not in IE8. - Under investigation *can't guarantee a fix this week*

all done ~ ( one's that weren't in please wait state ) Those are still to do: 4) Landing page - we want to remove the promos on this page and extend the picture down, so that it can show a range of different pictures which we are using in the ad campaign, while also featuring one clear link above the fold to 'Enter the site'. I'm not sure if this is something you can do or if I need to send this back to McCann to rework entirely. Can we discuss this? - will wait for McCann to come back, we just need the CSS/HTML for the 'Content'
It may be best to send them a link to the live site so they can edit the page and just change this bit, we will then need to move it back into the CMS
... this is the div that changes ...
* Dependent on McCann / plus time to implement * 5) Home page - media pod - is it possible for me to edit this using the XML? Is this still hosted by McCann? I think we need to ensure this is hosted by us, as we will need to ensure it goes on the cloud ready for launch on 27 July. - Need McCann to supply a new Flash player that takes a local XML or JSON file or the Flash movie should accept a list of values. * Dependent on McCann / plus time to implement *

Hi Lars

Thanks for these – excellent stuff. Just a couple of spots on the below.

Pink include ‘Volunteer in your area’ (not the same as the other pink include where the text is too big) – this is still linking to a path which doesn’t exist. Both graphic and text should link to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php The rollover link is also still black instead of white

Thank you!

Morag
Could you also please remove from the Volunteering about hub template the feature boxes for Related photos and Related videos? Thank you!

Hey Morag, i think i'm though with your list :)

1. Volunteering in your area link and rollover colors
2. Inverted map layout 
3. Submit button copy change
4. Pink module -> I've amended this module to be variable in height which makes it look a little better and
saves us all the size problems, if you still want me to change the headline font to something smaller, please
let me know.
5. Volunteering about hub

I'm going to test the change i did on number 4 in Internet explorer now.

Hi Lars,

Brilliant! Just a couple of notes:

Pink include rollover text is still showing black in IE8 – see grab below

Access Games Maker form – have just sent through some additional text tweaks – is it possible to look at these as well?

Pink module for application status – could you make the headline font just a bit smaller and bold it?

Everything else is brilliant – thanks!

[cid:image001.png@01CB19F3.AD1AC070]
Morag, thats all done ~ but what are the additional text tweaks?

Ooh, sorry, posted them in another post. Here they are:

Is it possible to make a couple of tweaks to the text at the bottom of the accessible form if you select 'Yes' to 'Medical condition / accessibility requirements'? Changes are surrounded by asterisks (asterisks should not be included)
Medical condition / accessibility requirements
Do you have any medical conditions *or accessibility requirements* that we should be aware of when allocating roles at Games time or when arranging your interview?
Please provide details of any medical conditions *or accessibility requirements* that we should be aware of. We will use this information to ensure all such reasonable adjustments as are required can be made to allow you to attend for interview and to try to ensure you are allocated a role in the Games that you can do and enjoy. Alternatively please contact us at a suitable time.
[Change to field name underneath this text] *Medical condition/Accessibility requirements*

oh i did those already, the field name => Medical condition/Accessibility requirements is now to long so it wraps but its here
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/access-games-maker/index.php
Marking as solved.
Agreed
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

comments.value:
Hi guys,

This is rearing its ugly little head again.

Some options for you to consider / quote on:

1)      How is Kitsite set up to do a postcode search of the open weekend events?  So if a post code were entered, finding events within a certain radius?

2)      Could we just show the postcode of the event next to the date it's occurring?  Apparently people want to be able to tell at a glance if it's near them

Two is clearly easier than 1.  Please let me know estimates for both!  The OW team will need to pay!

Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

> 1) How is Kitsite set up to do a postcode search of the open weekend events? So if a post code were entered, finding events within a certain radius?

If you mean the CMS then that's a bit of a red herring, as the CMS only allows you to assign a postcode (or lat/long).

I assume you mean can we add a postcode to the front end search, the answer is yes but it's not just a case of adding a postcode field to the form nor do we have some ready to use code to deploy out of the box.

Some sites do this in a hacky way by /trying to/ (it's not accurate) stripping off the first bit of postcode entered up until a latter or space ie. 'N1 4DG' or 'N14DG' and then trying to match any postcode starting with those letters. That however doesn't deal with borders very well ie. N1 next to E8 

The proper way is to do it is to add a lat/long to every event, you get this for free if you use the location picker in the CMS but not from user submitted events. Then when someone does a search we also turn the postcode they entered into a lat/long coordinate and then for each result returned use a bit of maths to work out the distance between the two points and therefore whether it falls within an acceptable radius.

The short answer is no we don't have it and no we couldn't implement it this week.

But if it is a feature you want (and if your dealing with events it does obviously makes sense) we can look at implementing it

Although it would almost certainly take the best part of a week to get up and running as we need to upgrade the search engine, write some wrapper code, update the search form, get the back end of the form to turn the postcode entered into a lat/long, assign lat/longs to all the legacy events, set it up so it does this automatically in future, test, deploy, test etc.

> 2) Could we just show the postcode of the event next to the date it's occurring? Apparently people want to be able to tell at a glance if it's near them


You mean in the results? if so, certainly, mainly (*) just a case of deciding where it goes.

* I think we also need to refresh/republish all the events as I don't think we currently store the postcode in the 'front end' search engine, so we would first need to add it as a indexable field and bulk update all the events so we can pull it back out when people do a search.

Jamie

1) For curiosity for future development, can you quote how long it would take?

2) Yeah, that’s precisely what i mean. I *think* the most sensible place for it to go is next to the date. But can you quote an amount of time and I’ll get the OW team to pay? I think most of the other changes are things that other po’s or the retainer will cover (I’ll need to double check) but this is clearly one for them!

> 1) For curiosity for future development, can you quote how long it would take?

<snip>...it would almost certainly take the best part of a week to get up and running..</snip>

* that may be an underestimate though, just asked Kieran to confirm what is involved in changing the backend of the search engine to handle spacial searches.

> 2) Yeah, that’s precisely what i mean. 

0.3 of a day ?

(* OK adding it will probably take 60 mins, but once we add in sign off on where it goes, make some tweaks, write some CSS, check that CSS works on IE6/7/8 etc. I expect the morning will have disappeared)

Actually Liz,

Hold the front page...

We don't have the postcode in the search index so expect it will take us just under half a day to get this changed.

0.5 day

Jamie

Cool.

For 2) I’ll get confirmation they’re happy to pay £210!
Cool. £350. I’ll go check

They're raising a PO.  Please go ahead with 2) right away!

High priority
PO 9080. Thanks, Liz.

This is now setup, although we haven't yet republished all events

You can see it on this event though
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php?age=openweekend&owd1=yes&owd2=yes&owd3=yes&regionfilter=&typefilter=&q=King+Harald&x=19&y=7

I did try with a "Postcode:" prefix but it looked a bit heavy handed? Maybe we shoudl split out just he start of the postcode or link it off to the map (I think I have the url to do that somewhere) ?

thoughts

Jamie

Apparently what the *really* wanted was the post-code field to appear under ‘place’ on the individual event details pages. Can we please do that as well? (sorry, i must have misunderstood)

I still think what we’ve done is valuable. I think writing postcode: is necessary ... otherwise it just looks a smidge random?

Hi Liz,

I have added the postcode and made it a hyperlink to the map, I hope that is OK? It just seemed sensible / useful.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/events/the-rat-trail-at-hollytrees-museum-colchester.php

I have also added in 'Postcode:" to the search results page but I wonder if showing region / borough is actually more useful in the search results? I have all three values in the search index now so can change /fairly/ easily if required.

Jamie

Woo hoo. Let’s go live with what’s there now, and i can think about switching the postcode to region/borough in the next few days.

Thanks.
Have we pushed this live / republished all events? If not, might be good to do so tonight? Let me know if you’re planning on it – I’ll need to go and lock a bunch.
Just doign them all now (well only the ones that have been previously published / are currently published)
Ah, cool. Glad you can do it that way – makes my life WAY easier!
Marking as solved.

subject: postcode searching for events [part 1, postcode next to events in search listings]
description:
Hi guys,

This is rearing its ugly little head again.

Some options for you to consider / quote on:

1)      How is Kitsite set up to do a postcode search of the open weekend events?  So if a post code were entered, finding events within a certain radius?

2)      Could we just show the postcode of the event next to the date it's occurring?  Apparently people want to be able to tell at a glance if it's near them

Two is clearly easier than 1.  Please let me know estimates for both!  The OW team will need to pay!

Liz Goulding
New Media Producer

www.twitter.com/london2012

comments.value:
I’m so sorry to have to say that the internal client has completely done a 180-degree turn on this.

They are now saying that after discussions yesterday they have decided it would be too confusing for users to have to enter their email address and both a username and password.

I’m really sorry but is there anyway we could change it so applicants only have to enter their email address and a password (which they want to rename as an ‘identifier’) i.e. switch off the group name field.

I can already hear your groan but can you advise:
1)	Is this something which can be done for Monday? And if it’s not, then fine – I can’t believe their timing
2)	Can we also rename the ‘Password’ field label to ‘Identifier’ 
3) We need to change the tooltips - Can we add to the help icon for email address:
"You will need your own email address and you must ensure that no-one else uses the same email address to submit an application." For the identifier help icon, can the help icon read: "Enter the identifier you’ve received". See the diagram attached.


Sorry.......
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

Thanks Alex From: George Middleton Sent: 17 June 2010 16:19 To: Alexandra Brown Subject: RE: CC page updated text Here is: ________________________________ From: Alexandra Brown Sent: 17 June 2010 16:16 To: George Middleton Subject: RE: CC page updated text Will you take a screengrab (printscreen and send to me)? From: George Middleton Sent: 17 June 2010 16:15 To: Alexandra Brown Subject: RE: CC page updated text No it just kept coming up with error saying couldn't find all the links and the saving never stopped saving! ________________________________ From: Alexandra Brown Sent: 17 June 2010 16:14 To: George Middleton Subject: RE: CC page updated text Has it logged you out? I have done the NoW page and main page btw. Alex From: George Middleton Sent: 17 June 2010 16:13 To: Alexandra Brown Subject: CC page updated text Hi Alex, final update to CR pages is giving me some headaches. The links in the below updated text seem to be stopping me from saving? Already took the View Tube one out but still no joy. Are you about tomorrow to have a look at this and pics generally for the pages? George The 40 members of this year's Olympic Park Construction Crew are set to graduate this summer having learned about London 2012's key themes. The local schoolchildren also gained, and shared with their peers, new skills in leadership and responsibility. In the past year they met Her Majesty The Queen 005/her-majesty-the-queen-makes-first-visit-to-london-2012-o.php> , Archbishop Desmond Tutu tutu-visits-the-olympic-park.php> and President Zuma of South Africa esident-of-south-africa-jacob-zuma-visits-olympic-park.php> who were visiting the Park. Some members also attended the launch of the new ArcelorMittal rcelormittal-as-tier-two-supporter.php> Orbit at City Hall. The original 20 members from the 2008 Construction Crew are now project graduates, spread across a number of different London secondary schools. The ODA continues to work with the graduates, most recently taking them on a tour of the Park and to visit the View Tube. Forty new Construction Crew members are now being selected for next year's programme, which starts in September 2010. Again, they are aged ten and are from 20 schools from within the five Host Boroughs. All resources created for the Construction Crew are made available on the London 2012 Education website, Get Set . Construction Crew schools have become a part of the Get Set network, gaining access to new opportunities.
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Hi Alex,

It looks liek the page beign linked to has been deleted while George was editing that page, could that be the case?
No, that isn’t the case. The pages haven’t been deleted.

Hi Alex,

Ah I wonder if George is copy/pasting the text in with links ? (the text below has links in it)

I have stripped them out of the text below, can you re-try pasting the test in and then just assigning one link at a a time?

* I would obv. do this for you, but I just tested it and it works for me, so its more to see if it's still an issue for you (or george)

--

The 40 members of this year's Olympic Park Construction Crew are set to 
graduate this summer having learned about London 2012's key themes. The 
local schoolchildren also gained, and shared with their peers, new 
skills in leadership and responsibility. In the past year they met Her 
Majesty The Queen, Archbishop Desmond Tutu and President Zuma of South Africa who were 
visiting the Park. Some members also attended the launch of the new 
ArcelorMittal Orbit at City Hall.

The original 20 members from the 2008 Construction Crew are now project 
graduates, spread across a number of different London secondary schools. 
The ODA continues to work with the graduates, most recently taking them 
on a tour of the Park and to visit the View Tube.

Forty new Construction Crew members are now being selected for next 
year's programme, which starts in September 2010. Again, they are aged 
ten and are from 20 schools from within the five Host Boroughs.

All resources created for the Construction Crew are made available on 
the London 2012 Education website, Get Set 

--
Ok, thanks – we’ll look at tomorrow morning.

Hi there

Here are the media pod assets, as discussed. 

Is this all you need?

How easy will this be to integrate so that we can edit the XML?

Morag

Hello - is this okay or do you need anything else from me?
Still implementing/testing on the dev server at the moment..

Hi Morag,

We've finally got the pod player in place and working (we had a couple issues with getting the paths to work once we moved it into the CMS)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/index.php

You can edit the XML file direct here in the CMS (it's in the /data folder at the root of the CMS) if you want a new video/image/text just add another <item> block with the relevant type, images paths take the form of the full path minus the first slash) 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/data/data.xml

I was about to make an 'special' editor for this file in the CMS but then thought that it's probably only yourself that will update it and once it's live you only add the occasional change to it, so it bay be quicker to just leave you rto edit the XML direct; is that is OK?

One issue, which is OK for now, but may cause issues later on if we ever have another similar player, is the Flash movie is hardcoded to find the data.xml file at the root of the site/cms in a /data folder. It would be better if we could specify where to find the data.xml folder or get the Flash movie to look for it in the same or a sub folder of the Flash movie. To save complexity it may be best to leave as is for the moment, but if we do this again need to remember to let Jonathan know this is an issue.

Any issues just shout !!
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

comments.value:
The 'accessible form' checkbox doesn't seem to work. Can you investigate this?

Also, the team feel very strongly that they want to have the group name as well as the password in the form. I know we have had long conversations about this - but please can you add this in? Please let me know if you need me to resend the names.

Thanks!

We'll add  in the 'group' box

I think the checkbox issue may be a side effect of double clicking the submit while the browser is doing a redirect, I have opened another ticket and asked Janos ot take a look at this.

Thanks!

I don’t think I am double clicking submit, but it is worth see if it makes a difference.

To be honest I didn't think I was doing it either..

When you say it doesn't work do you mean you don't get taken to the form?
No, it just displays the password you have typed in

We have applied a change http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1038 so that you now can't 'double submit' (as the second attempt in quick succession could cause you to get the 'you have already submitted error').

I am also wondering if the issue you are describing is a natural side effect of us limiting the number of request from a single iP address, obviously if you we're all doing concurrent testing and all coming from the same IP block you would block each other out.

We have now also loosened the requirements so that as well as coming from the same IP address you also need to have used the same email address to be temporarily blocked (this has a major flaw in that someone can easily write a script to call the page thousands of times from the same IP address but just with different email addresses; faking an IP address is much harder).

We may need to have a discussion here about what best to do re. security vs annoyance esp. as if alot of people get their emails at the same time and belong to the same organization they may hit the same issue as you.

The ideals would be have to made the password or pre-reg code an signed/encrypted version of the email address, that way each person would have their own unique 'invite' that could only be used by them and only used a maximum number of times. But my guess is that is unworkable from a business point of view, esp. if you aren't sending the invites/pre-reg emails out.

The other option is obviously a Captcha, but wasn't the whole point of the Accessible form that it mustn't have a captcha?

Anyway let us know if the form now works for you.

Jamie

Thanks for this explanation, Jamie.

It is working now, but I take your point that this is less secure.

We can’t IP restrict as there will be lots of people from the same organisation applying, as you rightly say. The encrypted password and captcha options are not workable either.

I would like to sit down with you and Jag after testing next week to go through this if possible please so we can make it fully robust for go-live.

Thank you!

Morag

As you need a code/password/identifier to submit the form the possibility for misuse is somewhat limited as you need to code to misuse the form (hadn't though this 100% though before).

The live / ATOS volunteering form is somewhat different, as anyone can access it, so in theory (although TBH why would anyone bother?) someone could submit multiple requests to be a volunteer and clog up hte bakcend with fake volunteering applications. I assume though that ATOS are logging the IP address of each application request so if this did happen (although TBH why would anyone bother?) it would be trivial to purge the rogue requests (plus I assume they would look fake).

In terms of a Denial of Service attack, I can think of a dozen better places to repeatedly hit on the site if we wanted to cause issues, this isn't one of them.

The most common cases where you need Captcha's are:

i) Contact Us forms (ripe for abuse, ie. disgruntled person sending in 1000's of messages to clog up you CRM system) 
ii) Signup forms on things like Email services where they want to stop people automating the creation of 1000's of accounts which in turn could be used to send Spam
iii) Send to a Friend style features where without a Captcha or other mechanism a spammer can use the feature to send emails via your servers [this is only really an issue if a message can also be added].

In short I ATOS probably have one to eliminate the off chance that someone tries to pump the backend full of fake requests, but as the Specialist Registration needs a password (and a hacker or script-kiddy) isn't goign to have that password I'd say it's a non-issue.

comments.value:
Hi Liz,

We were just looking at how images get uploaded and as you know Janos has been cleaning up how this works. 

What were wondering is do you want us to automatically assign the image to the event, this will mean the team will have to check the event to make sure the image is OK. The image won't be published till the event is published, but if the event is published before the event is checked a bad image could obviously go live.

I noticed there is a 'image uploaded' filed - was this meant to be a flag to alert the OW team to check this event more carefully in the CMS due to the presence of an image before publishing it?

Jamie

Culture, Ceremonies, Education & Live Sites Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 314

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd One Churchill Place Canary Wharf London E14 5LN

london2012.com

-----Original Message-----
From: Caroline Brown
Sent: 24 June 2010 11:57
To: Roli Barker
Subject: FW: re attempting to register the other 2 venues for project 'Opening Doors/Sharing Spaces' for London Open Weekend 23-25th July

Hi Roli

Please see below email regarding error notice when submitting an application on the Open Weekend website.

Regards,
Caroline

-----Original Message-----
From: Jane MAKOWER [mailto:jane.makower@btconnect.com]
Sent: 23 June 2010 20:20
To: Caroline Brown
Subject: re attempting to register the other 2 venues for project 'Opening Doors/Sharing Spaces' for London Open Weekend 23-25th July

Dear Caroline 
 
I did try to register the other two venues through the London Open Weekend Website this evening -  but for both of them the site registered a fault and asked me to report it. 
i hope you are the correct person to report it to!
 
I have tried to save the pages and attach them so you can see what I was attempting to submit.
 
What do I do next?
 
Please excuse the signature (it's my work address)
 
With Best Wishes
jane Makower Mather 
 
makower fashion fabrics
The Hay Barn
118 Greys Road
Henley on Thames
OXON RG9 1QW

Some debug info.. I fixed this by reassigning the images in Firefox (so maybe this is a CMS / IE8 bug?) Page: (template = generic hub) http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/jobs/working-for-the-oda/construction-jobs-and-skills/index.php Image: (460x287) http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/olympic-park/construction-job2-460x287.jpg Template: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/Generic%20hub.template Page HTML:
..snip.. ..snip..
Template HTML:

Hi Alex,

I fixed this by clearing and reassigning the images in Firefox.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/jobs/working-for-the-oda/construction-jobs-and-skills/index.php

--

But we are wondering how it happened, it was actually quite odd what had happened n the back end, did you assign the images, if so assume you just did what you normally do? Are you using IE8 now? 

I have added all of me debugging / investigation work to this ticket (so if we hit the problem again we will have it to hand). 

I think lets just hope this was a one off quirk, if it happens again, we'll do some further research into how we can recreate the issue (whenever we want) and then look at a fix.

Jamie
Jamie, you've marked this as 0 billable days. Is that deliberate?
Yep it's not billable, it's bug in the cms I expect..

comments.value:
1) Add an additional check box which when checked (if other details are valid) will redirect users to the Accessible 'Access now' form.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/access-now/index.php

NB: We will require label / help text  for this checkbox.

2) Add an additional field to the form for the username (group name) to be entered, along with a check for the validity of this field and appropriate error handling / display of message.

NB1: If we leave the field on the current form as the 'password/codeword' field this new field should have no effect other than being an extra field that is checked in addition to the password field.
NB2: We will need new label / help text / error message for this field ie. Username / Enter the username you we're supplied / You failed to enter a user name / The user name you entered was invalid.

Oops, our emails crossed.

Have sent label for this checkbox. I don’t think we need extra Help text.

Re: point 2, I thought the extra field to add was the password as we already have the username?

Janos,

1) I have already added the check box, the check for it and the alt-redirect on dev.

(might be nice to make the check box sticky so if you get an error and have already checked the box it stays checked).

2) I have added in the user name field this is simply the group name/user name field. TBH I'm still not sure if they really need this, I expect if we add it in they will ask us to remove it after they have done some user testing and realise it's superfluous and offers no extra security, just extra confusion.

Jamie
Checkbox is now sticky.
Janos, could you add an estimate for "actual days". Thanks.
Oh actually, ignore me. It looks like it's part of "Volunteering site - password protection" http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/905

subject: Changes to the Volunteering pre-reg form
description:
1) Add an additional check box which when checked (if other details are valid) will redirect users to the Accessible 'Access now' form.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/access-now/index.php

NB: We will require label / help text  for this checkbox.

2) Add an additional field to the form for the username (group name) to be entered, along with a check for the validity of this field and appropriate error handling / display of message.

NB1: If we leave the field on the current form as the 'password/codeword' field this new field should have no effect other than being an extra field that is checked in addition to the password field.
NB2: We will need new label / help text / error message for this field ie. Username / Enter the username you we're supplied / You failed to enter a user name / The user name you entered was invalid.
